description:
MongoDB dashboard based on graphite data-source and telegraf collector. Focused on replica set.


Credit to https://grafana.com/orgs/saada who dashboard was the starting guide to this but using a different datasource: https://grafana.com/dashboards/2583

panels.description:
The time difference between the oldest and newest entries in the oplog. Thatâ€™s the amount of time an operation will remain in the oplog before being overwritten by a new entry.

Firstly, your replication oplog window tells you how long a secondary member can be offline and still catch up to the primary without doing a full resync

The second, and more subtle, issue is that replication oplog window is also the maximum amount of time it can take to perform the initial phase of a full sync (either when adding a new secondary, or fully resyncing a stale one)
panels.title: Replication Oplog Window

alert.message: A member of the MongoDB replica set is no longer acting as a "primary" or "secondary"
alert.name: Alert for replica status alert

panels.description:
If state move out of range 1:2 then will alert
Each value maps to a state see:
panels.title: Replica set member state

alert.message:
A MongoDB oplog replication has been 5 minutes behind in its replication for more than 15 minutes.
Being able to fail over to a replica of your data is only useful if the data is up to date, so you need to know when thatâ€™s no longer the case!
alert.name: MongoDB Oplog lag alert

alert.message: MongoDB's average disk i/o utilization has been above 98% for 5 minutes
alert.name: MongoDB's Disk IO Utilization alert

panels.description:
Hardcoded to show prd, alerts dont work with template variables.

For reference on getting percent value:
panels.title: Disk IO Utilization (prd only)

title: Mongo
